titles.en: Chapter 9 – The devotion upon the supplication
Chapter 9 – The devotion upon the supplication

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ عَمْرٍو قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَا يَسْتَجِيبُ دُعَاءً بِظَهْرِ قَلْبٍ سَاهٍ فَإِذَا دَعَوْتَ فَأَقْبِلْ بِقَلْبِكَ ثُمَّ اسْتَيْقِنْ بِالْإِجَابَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Sayf Bin Ameyra, from Suleyman Bin Amro who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic does not Answer a supplication manifested by an inattentive heart. So whenever you do supplicate, be attentive with your heart, then be convinced of it being Answered’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْأَشْعَرِيِّ عَنِ ابْنِ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( صلوات الله عليه )  لَا يَقْبَلُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ دُعَاءَ قَلْبٍ لَاهٍ وَ كَانَ عَلِيٌّ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِذَا دَعَا أَحَدُكُمْ لِلْمَيِّتِ فَلَا يَدْعُو لَهُ وَ قَلْبُهُ لَاهٍ عَنْهُ وَ لَكِنْ لِيَجْتَهِدْ لَهُ فِي الدُّعَاءِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad Al Ashary, from Ibn Al Qaddah, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic does not Accept a supplication of an unmindful heart’; and it was so that Ali<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘Whenever one of you supplicates for the deceased, so he should no supplicate for him while his heart is unmindful from him, but let him strive for him in the supplication’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ سُلَيْمٍ الْفَرَّاءِ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا دَعَوْتَ فَأَقْبِلْ بِقَلْبِكَ وَ ظُنَّ حَاجَتَكَ بِالْبَابِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from one of his companions, from Sayf Bin Ameyra, from Suleym Al Farra’a, from the one who mentioned it, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whenever you supplicate, so be attentive with your heart and thinking that (the fulfilment of) your need is at the door (imminent)’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَا يَسْتَجِيبُ دُعَاءً بِظَهْرِ قَلْبٍ قَاسٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ismail Bin Mihran, from Sayf Bin Ameyra, from the one who mentioned it, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic does not Answer a supplication manifested by a cruel heart’.

verses.text:
عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَمَّا اسْتَسْقَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَ سُقِيَ النَّاسُ حَتَّى قَالُوا إِنَّهُ الْغَرَقُ وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِيَدِهِ وَ رَدَّهَا اللَّهُمَّ حَوَالَيْنَا وَ لَا عَلَيْنَا 
قَالَ فَتَفَرَّقَ السَّحَابُ فَقَالُوا يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ اسْتَسْقَيْتَ لَنَا فَلَمْ نُسْقَ ثُمَّ اسْتَسْقَيْتَ لَنَا فَسُقِينَا قَالَ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ وَ لَيْسَ لِي فِي ذَلِكَ نِيَّةٌ ثُمَّ دَعَوْتُ وَ لِيَ فِي ذَلِكَ نِيَّةٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Al Hakam, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> supplicated for the rain and the people were drenched to the extent that they said, ‘It’s drowning (us)’, and Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said (gestured) by his<sup>saww</sup> hand and returned it: ‘O Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Around us and not upon us!” 
He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘So the clouds dispersed, and they said, ‘O Rasool-Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup>! You<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> supplicated for the rain for us but we were not quenched, then you<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> supplicated for the rain for us, so we were quenched’. He<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> said: ‘I<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> supplicated and there was no intention for me<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> during that, then I<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> supplicated, and for me<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> there was an intention regarding that’.
